intro: Chorisandrachne, commonly known as the "false dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers, typical of the daisy family. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are usually alternate, lanceolate, and covered in fine hairs. Chorisandrachne is often mistaken for true dandelions due to its similar appearance and growth habits.
